---

# W. P. Carey Inc. (WPC) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

W. P. Carey ranks among the largest net lease REITs with a well-diversified portfolio of high-quality, operationally critical commercial real estate, which includes 1,600 net lease properties covering approximately 178 million square feet and a portfolio of 66 self-storage operating properties as of June 30, 2025. With offices in New York, London, Amsterdam and Dallas, the company remains focused on investing primarily in single-tenant, industrial, warehouse and retail properties located in the U.S. and Europe, under long-term net leases with built-in rent escalations.

The company was founded by William Polk Carey in 1973 and is headquartered in New York, NY. Founded in 1973, W. P. Carey has a long history of providing capital solutions to publicly traded and privately-held companies, developers, private equity firms and their portfolio companies. We create custom deal structures to address the unique needs of each seller through sale-leasebacks, build-to-suits and acquisitions of existing net leases.

The company operates as a real estate investment trust (REIT) focused on net lease commercial properties and generates revenue primarily through long-term lease agreements with built-in rent escalations.

## 2. Current Market Data

The latest closing stock price for W.P Carey as of January 16, 2026 is 70.26. The market cap of W.P. Carey (WPC) is approximately 14.5B. The W.P Carey 52-week high stock price is 70.28, which is 0% above the current share price. The W.P Carey 52-week low stock price is 53.93, which is 23.2% below the current share price.

WPC's trailing dividend yield is 5.53. Trailing dividend yield is a financial metric used to measure the return on investment from a company's dividend payments over the past 12 months.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

W. P. Carey specializes in net lease real estate transactions across several key sectors:

• **Industrial and Warehouse Properties**: Single-tenant warehouse and industrial properties comprised approximately 68% of the Company's full-year investment volume, while retail properties comprised approximately 22%.

• **Sale-Leaseback Solutions**: We create custom deal structures to address the unique needs of each seller through sale-leasebacks, build-to-suits and acquisitions of existing net leases.

• **Self-Storage Properties**: 11 self-storage properties remain and are expected to be sold in 1H 2026.

• **Investment Management Services**: Its Investment Management unit generates revenue from providing real estate advisory and portfolio management services to other REITs.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

With a strong pipeline of high-quality opportunities to start 2026 and the vast majority of our anticipated equity needs for the year already accounted for — including around $420 million of forward equity, several-hundred million dollars of planned accretive asset sales and $250 to $300 million of expected retained cash flow — we're well-positioned to continue delivering attractive AFFO growth.

At year-end, W. P. Carey owned 11 self-storage operating properties, which it anticipates selling during the first half of 2026, further simplifying the Company.

## 5. Growth Strategy

W. P. Carey's growth strategy focuses on several key initiatives:

• **Industrial Property Focus**: To own W. P. Carey, you need to believe in the appeal of long-term, net lease income backed by diversified commercial tenants and a portfolio that is steadily tilting toward industrial and warehouse properties.

• **Capital Recycling**: The Company's 2025 disposition activity supported its ability to accretively fund new investments, primarily through the disposition of non-core assets at yields that generated around 150 basis points of spread to the initial cash cap rates at which it reinvested the proceeds.

• **Geographic Expansion**: From a geographic perspective, approximately 69% of its 2025 investment volume was located in the U.S. and 26% in Europe.

• **Portfolio Simplification**: 2025 marked a record high year for investment volume, closing $2.1 billion of deals funded primarily through accretive sales of non-core assets, highlighted by our effective exit from operating self-storage.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

**Top Tenants**:
• After the transaction, Life Time ranked as W. P. Carey's third-largest tenant by annualized base rent (ABR).
• Our top ten tenants represent 18.6% of ABR and have a weighted average lease term of 14.7 years.

**Specific Major Clients**:
• **Life Time Fitness**: Life Time is a market leader, with a significant revenue share of the total U.S. fitness industry and a dominant presence in the high-end club segment.
• **Hellweg**: Hellweg remained current on rent throughout 2025 and, as a result of re-tenanting and sales activity during the year, ranked as the Company's 17th largest tenant by ABR at year-end.

The company maintains relationships with approximately 400 tenants across various industries and geographies.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Results**:
• W.P. Carey Inc (WPC, Financial) reported a net income attributable to the company of $141.0 million for the third quarter, marking a 26.2% increase from $111.7 million in the same period last year.
• Total revenues were $431.3 million, up from $397.4 million a year ago, driven by lease revenues of $372.1 million. Net income attributable to W. P. Carey was $141.0 million, and diluted EPS was $0.64 versus $0.51 in Q3 2024.
• The company's AFFO per diluted share was $1.25, up 5.9% from $1.18 in the previous year, reflecting the accretive impact of net investment activity.

**2025 Guidance**:
• W.P. Carey Inc (WPC, Financial) raised its 2025 AFFO guidance range to between $4.93 and $4.99 per diluted share, based on higher anticipated full-year investment volume of between $1.8 billion and $2.1 billion.

**Full-Year 2024 Performance**:
• In 2024, W. P. Carey's revenue was $1.58 billion, a decrease of -9.22% compared to the previous year's $1.74 billion. Earnings were $460.84 million, a decrease of -34.94%.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds**:
• **Industrial Real Estate Demand**: W.P. Carey's portfolio pivot to industrial and warehouse assets positions it to benefit from long-term eCommerce growth trends and rising demand for logistics space.
• **Inflation Protection**: Around one-third of WPC's rent is derived from investment-grade tenants and the majority of its rent is CPI-linked which is uncommon in the triple net lease sector.
• **Market Recovery**: After several years marked by inflation, interest rate uncertainty and selective buyer activity, the U.S. net lease market enters 2026 with more clarity – and more momentum.

**Headwinds**:
• **Interest Rate Sensitivity**: Real estate valuations remain sensitive to interest rate fluctuations
• **Tenant Credit Risk**: Rent loss from tenant credit events was ~$6 million for 2025.
• **Self-Storage Exit**: Ongoing disposal of self-storage assets represents portfolio transition challenges

## 9. Market Shares

W. P. Carey ranks among the largest net lease REITs with a well-diversified portfolio of high-quality, operationally critical commercial real estate, positioning it as one of the leading players in the net lease REIT sector. The company competes with other major net lease REITs including Realty Income (O), National Retail Properties (NNN), and STAG Industrial.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

**Versus National Retail Properties (NNN)**:
• While NNN primarily focuses on retail real estate in the United States, WPC has a greater emphasis on industrial and warehouse real estate in both the United States and Europe.
• With a diversified portfolio of over 3,300 properties across 48 states and more than 380 national and regional retail tenants, NNN has established a stable cash flow profile, which has allowed it to achieve Dividend Aristocrat status with 33 consecutive years of dividend growth.

**Competitive Positioning**:
• WPC falls firmly in the large cap investment grade group of triple nets. This means its peer set consists of Realty Income (O) National Retail (NNN) and Agree Realty (ADC). Within this group we believe it is demonstrable that WPC is better positioned with better properties, fundamental outperformance and a more attractive valuation.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Acquisitions**:
• The company completed ~$625 million of investments in Q4 2025, including a $322 million Life Time Fitness portfolio.
• W. P. Carey completed the $322 million acquisition of 10 fitness facilities located in the U.S. The portfolio, totaling 1.3 million square feet, is net leased to Life Time Fitness, a premium lifestyle brand and fitness operator.

**Investment Activity**:
• W. P. Carey (NYSE: WPC) reported a record $2.1 billion of investment volume for full-year 2025 at a weighted-average initial cash cap rate of ~7.6% and an estimated average yield of ~9.2%.

## 12. Recent Developments

• **Record Investment Year**: W. P. Carey (NYSE: WPC) reported a record $2.1 billion of investment volume for full-year 2025 at a weighted-average initial cash cap rate of ~7.6% and an estimated average yield of ~9.2%.

• **Self-Storage Exit**: Full-year dispositions totaled $1.5 billion, including $785 million from self-storage sales; 11 self-storage properties remain and are expected to be sold in 1H 2026.

• **Dividend Increase**: W. P. Carey (NYSE: WPC) said its Board increased the quarterly cash dividend to $0.920 per share, equal to an annualized rate of $3.68 per share. The raise represents a 4.5% increase versus the 2024 fourth-quarter dividend.

• **Great Place to Work Certification**: W. P. Carey (NYSE: WPC), a leading net lease REIT, has achieved Great Place to Work Certification™ in both the U.S. and the Netherlands, with 95% of global employees rating it as a great workplace. The company also ranked fourth on Fortune's Best Small and Medium Workplaces in New York™ list for 2025.

• **Upcoming Earnings**: W. P. Carey Inc. (W. P. Carey, NYSE: WPC), a leading net lease REIT, announced today that it will release its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025 after the market closes on Tuesday, February 10, 2026. The company will host a conference call and live audio webcast to discuss its financial results on Wednesday, February 11, 2026 at 12:00 p.m. Eastern Time.

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Investment Rating: 7.2/10**

**Rationale**:
W. P. Carey demonstrates strong operational performance with record investment activity, successful portfolio transformation toward higher-growth industrial assets, and improving financial metrics. The company's strategic pivot away from self-storage and office properties toward industrial/warehouse assets positions it well for secular growth trends. Strong dividend coverage, investment-grade credit profile, and geographic diversification provide defensive characteristics.

**Fair Value Estimate: $75-$78**

Based on:
• Current AFFO run rate of approximately $4.93-$4.99 per share
• Industrial property premium valuations
• Successful capital recycling strategy generating 150+ basis point spreads
• Strong dividend yield coverage and growth trajectory
• Market leadership position in net lease REIT sector

**Key Investment Highlights**:
• Record $2.1 billion investment volume in 2025 with attractive cap rates
• Successful portfolio transformation to industrial focus (68% of investments)
• Strong AFFO growth trajectory with raised 2025 guidance
• Attractive dividend yield of 5.5%+ with 4.5% recent increase
• Investment-grade balance sheet with strong liquidity position
• Geographic diversification across U.S. and Europe markets

**Risks to Consider**:
• Interest rate sensitivity affecting property valuations
• Tenant concentration risk with top 10 tenants representing 18.6% of ABR
• Ongoing portfolio transition costs from self-storage exit
• General economic sensitivity affecting tenant creditworthiness
tldr_summary:
W. P. Carey is a leading net lease REIT that owns and manages high-quality commercial real estate properties across the United States and Europe, focusing primarily on industrial, warehouse, and retail properties with long-term net lease agreements.

The company has strategically transformed its portfolio, pivoting towards industrial assets (68% of investments) while divesting non-core self-storage properties. With a record $2.1 billion investment volume in 2025 and attractive cap rates around 7.6%, W. P. Carey demonstrates strong market positioning and growth potential. The company boasts a diversified tenant base of approximately 400 clients, investment-grade credit profile, and a robust dividend yield of 5.5%. Key competitive advantages include geographic diversification, inflation-protected leases, and a focus on operationally critical commercial real estate.

The AI investment rating is 7.2/10 with a fair value estimate of $75-$78, reflecting strong operational performance and strategic asset portfolio optimization.
